security_audit.summary: This skill contains only Markdown documentation with planning frameworks. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no environment variable access, and no external command execution. Pure prompt-based knowledge base.

content.value_statement: Developers often start coding without proper planning, leading to scope creep and technical debt. This framework provides Musk's 5-step algorithm and ICE scoring to systematically evaluate features before writing any code.
actual_capabilities: Apply Musk's 5-step algorithm (question requirements, delete, simplify, accelerate, automate)
Calculate ICE scores to prioritize features by Impact, Confidence, and Ease
Evaluate feature requests to identify simpler solutions before coding
Identify unnecessary code and dependencies using systematic deletion review
Create planning checklists before starting development tasks
Assess technical debt and refactoring needs using structured frameworks
limitations: Does not execute code or modify project files automatically
Does not integrate with project management tools or issue trackers
Does not provide time estimates for complex features
Does not access codebase to analyze existing architecture

use_cases.title: Plan Features Systematically
use_cases.description: Use ICE scoring and Musk's framework before starting any feature over 50 lines of code.

use_cases.title: Prioritize Backlog Items
use_cases.description: Evaluate feature requests using Impact, Confidence, and Ease to make data-driven prioritization decisions.

use_cases.title: Review Technical Debt
use_cases.description: Identify refactoring candidates and cleanup opportunities using structured deletion and simplification criteria.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Feature Eval
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the ICE scoring framework to evaluate this feature: [describe feature]. Calculate Impact, Confidence, and Ease scores (1-10 each), then compute the ICE score and recommend priority.

prompt_templates.title: Delete Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Musk's Step 2 (Delete) to this codebase section: [paste code]. What can be eliminated? What dependencies are unused? What logic serves no clear purpose?

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Decision
prompt_templates.prompt: Use Musk's 5-step algorithm to evaluate this architectural decision: [describe decision]. Question the requirements, identify what can be deleted, and determine if automation is appropriate.

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the planning checklist to refactor this component: [paste code >200 lines]. Identify extraction points, estimate effort, and create a step-by-step refactoring plan using the ICE framework.

output_examples.input: Should we add real-time WebSocket price updates to our portfolio charts?
output: Impact: 6 - Nice to have, but app analyzes historical data
Confidence: 5 - Complex integration, data source needed
Ease: 3 - WebSocket setup, state management, error handling
Recommendation: Skip for now - doesn't fit core use case

best_practices: Always complete Steps 1-3 (Question, Delete, Simplify) before starting any feature implementation
Calculate ICE scores for all features over 100 lines of code before prioritizing
Multiply initial time estimates by 2 to account for edge cases and testing
Review components when they exceed 200 lines and refactor before adding more features
anti_patterns: Starting to code before questioning requirements and checking for simpler solutions
Using 'any' types for quick implementation (technical debt accumulates)
Adding code 'for later' that never gets used (YAGNI - You Aren't Gonna Need It)
Automating processes before confirming they are necessary and proven

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Provides structured prompts for planning conversations.

faq.question: How accurate are ICE scores?
faq.answer: ICE scoring is subjective. Use it to compare relative priorities within your team, not as absolute metrics.

faq.question: Can this integrate with Jira or linear?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt framework. Copy ICE scores and recommendations to your project management tool manually.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill contains only prompts and documentation. No code execution, file access, or data collection occurs.

faq.question: Why is Step 2 'Delete' before Step 3 'Simplify'?
faq.answer: Deleting unnecessary parts first makes simplification easier. Remove what does not belong before improving what remains.

faq.question: How does this compare to other planning methods?
faq.answer: Combines Musk's engineering philosophy with ICE prioritization. More actionable than user stories, more structured than ad-hoc planning.
